intro: Impatiens wirabraja, commonly known as the Malagasy impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers that typically range from pink to red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
